javadoc:
The default {@link VisualGraph} renderer. By default, the shape returned by this class is a {@link Rectangle} of the given vertex's {@link VisualVertex#getComponent() component}.

This class is aware of {@link VertexShapeProvider}s, which allows vertex creators to provide vertex shapes that differ for rendering and clicking. See that class for more info. @param the vertex type

methods.name: transformToCompactShape
methods.comment:
Returns the compact shape that the user will see when full, detailed rendering is 
 not being performed for a vertex, such as in the satellite viewer or when fully-zoomed-out

methods.name: transformToFullShape
methods.comment:
Returns the full (the actual) shape of a vertex.  This can be used to determine if a 
 mouse point intersects a vertex or to get the real bounding-box of a vertex.

name: VisualGraphVertexShapeTransformer
comment:
The default VisualGraph renderer.  By default, the shape returned by this class is
 a Rectangle of the given vertex's VisualVertex#getComponent().
 
 This class is aware of VertexShapeProviders, which allows vertex creators to 
 provide vertex shapes that differ for rendering and clicking.  See that class for more info.
